back_cards.definition_en: A flat piece of material used in construction or furniture
back_cards.example_en: The carpenter installed a wooden panel on the wall.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of experts discussing a topic
back_cards.example_en: The panel of scientists debated climate change solutions.

back_cards.definition_en: A section of a control system with instruments
back_cards.example_en: The pilot checked the control panel before takeoff.

back_cards.definition_en: A decorative piece in art or design
back_cards.example_en: The museum displayed a carved stone panel from ancient Rome.
The panel awarded her the prize for best presentation.

back_cards.definition_en: A person admired for brave deeds
back_cards.example_en: The firefighter was a hero for saving the child.

back_cards.definition_en: The main character in a story
back_cards.example_en: The novel’s hero faced many challenges to find the treasure.
Her grandmother was her hero for overcoming hardship.

back_cards.definition_en: A figure in mythology with great strength
back_cards.example_en: Hercules is a legendary hero in Greek tales.

back_cards.definition_en: A person celebrated in a community
back_cards.example_en: The athlete became a local hero after winning the gold medal.

back_cards.definition_en: A round shape with all points equidistant from the center
back_cards.example_en: She drew a perfect circle on the paper.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of people with shared interests
back_cards.example_en: Her book club was a tight circle of friends.

back_cards.definition_en: A seating arrangement in a round formation
back_cards.example_en: The students sat in a circle during story time.
The seasons move in a circle every year.
The park is within the circle of downtown.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who reviews art, movies, or books
back_cards.example_en: The film critic gave the movie five stars.
Her boss was a harsh critic of her work.
The music critic praised the orchestra’s performance.

back_cards.definition_en: A person skeptical of ideas or plans
back_cards.example_en: He was a critic of the new government policy.
The critic wrote a detailed essay on the novel’s themes.

back_cards.definition_en: To find an answer to a problem
back_cards.example_en: She worked hard to solve the math puzzle.
The team met to solve their disagreements.
The technician was called to solve the computer glitch.
The detective tried to solve the case quickly.
They brainstormed ideas to solve the budget shortfall.

back_cards.definition_en: Having a lot of work or tasks
back_cards.example_en: She was too busy to answer the phone.
The market was busy with shoppers on Saturday.
He kept himself busy fixing the car.
The painting was busy with bright colors and patterns.

back_cards.definition_en: Engaged in a call or line
back_cards.example_en: The phone line was busy when I called.

back_cards.definition_en: One part of a TV or radio series
back_cards.example_en: I watched the latest episode of my favorite show.
The argument was an unfortunate episode in their friendship.
The podcast’s new episode discussed space travel.
He recovered from a brief episode of fever.
The book’s final episode revealed the secret.

back_cards.definition_en: To return to a previous place
back_cards.example_en: She went back to her hometown for the holidays.
He stepped back to avoid the puddle.
The shop was back in business after the flood.
I’ll call you back after the meeting.
Her friends backed her up during the debate.
She checked her homework before submitting it.
He checked the tasks off his to-do list.
The guard checked my ID at the entrance.
The mechanic checked the car’s brakes.
She checked her anger during the argument.
A visa is a requirement for international travel.
The job’s requirement was five years of experience.
The software met all the client’s requirements.
Math is a requirement for the engineering program.
Safety gear is a requirement in the factory.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who holds a government office
back_cards.example_en: The politician gave a speech about healthcare reform.
She campaigned as a politician for city council.
The politician worked to pass new environmental laws.

back_cards.definition_en: A person skilled in political strategy
back_cards.example_en: He was a clever politician who won debates easily.
The politician met with community leaders to discuss issues.
The rain soaked my clothes during the walk.
The forecast predicted rain all weekend.
The sudden rain caused flooding in the streets.
A rain of confetti fell during the celebration.
The rain canceled our picnic in the park.
My colleague helped me finish the project on time.

back_cards.definition_en: A peer in the same profession
back_cards.example_en: She met her colleagues at the medical conference.
Our colleagues organized a surprise office party.
He and his colleague co-wrote the report.

back_cards.definition_en: A contact in a similar field
back_cards.example_en: Her colleague from another firm shared useful data.
The sun disappeared behind the mountain.
My phone disappeared from the table.
The pain disappeared after a few hours.
He disappeared after the meeting ended.
Some species disappear due to habitat loss.

back_cards.definition_en: An alcoholic drink made from yeast-fermented malt
back_cards.example_en: He ordered a cold beer at the pub.

back_cards.definition_en: A beverage served at social events
back_cards.example_en: They brought beer to the beach party.

back_cards.definition_en: A specific type of ale or lager
back_cards.example_en: This beer is brewed locally with hops.
The spicy wings taste great with this beer.
Beer is popular at music festivals.
Meteorologists predict rain this afternoon.
She predicted the team would win the match.
The model predicts rising sea levels.
Analysts predict a rise in stock prices.
He predicted his friend would be late again.
She does exercise every morning to stay fit.

back_cards.definition_en: A task to practice a skill
back_cards.example_en: The math exercise helped students learn fractions.
The army conducted a defense exercise.
Solving puzzles is good exercise for the brain.
Yoga is her favorite exercise for relaxation.
She was tired after working all day.
The hikers were tired after climbing the hill.
He was tired of hearing the same excuse.
The baby was tired and fell asleep quickly.
She felt tired from all the stress.

back_cards.definition_en: A system of government by the people
back_cards.example_en: Democracy allows citizens to vote for leaders.
She spoke about democracy in her speech.
The country transitioned to a democracy.
Democracy thrives when people share ideas.
They fought to protect democracy.
She worked hard and ultimately succeeded.
Ultimately, health is more important than money.
They argued but ultimately agreed.
Her decision was ultimately about family.
The project was delayed but ultimately completed.
The novel’s setting was a small village.
She changed the setting on her phone.
The meeting’s setting was a quiet office.

back_cards.definition_en: A background in art or film
back_cards.example_en: The movie’s setting was a futuristic city.

back_cards.definition_en: A time period in a story
back_cards.example_en: The story’s setting was the 1800s.
They gave her an award in honor of her work.
He acted with honor during the crisis.
It was an honor to meet the president.
The statue was built in honor of the soldiers.
She was addressed as ‘Your Honor’ in court.
The museum displayed the artist’s works.
The clock’s works were carefully repaired.
Her charitable works helped the community.
He visited the steel works in the city.
Shakespeare’s works are studied worldwide.
Unfortunately, the event was canceled.
She studied hard but unfortunately failed.
Unfortunately, we missed the last train.
The car broke down, unfortunately.
Unfortunately, I can’t attend the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: The main idea of a story
back_cards.example_en: The theme of the book was courage.
The party had a tropical theme.
Equality was a theme in her speeches.
The movie’s theme played during the credits.
The class explored the theme of nature.
The team discussed the issue of low sales.
Climate change is a global issue.
I read the latest issue of the magazine.
He’s dealing with some health issues.
The bank issued new credit cards.
The male students formed a soccer team.
The male character led the story.
The male peacock has colorful feathers.
He wore a male fragrance to the event.
The survey focused on male voters.
The kitchen was clean after she scrubbed it.
The river provided clean drinking water.
Her desk was always clean and tidy.
The athlete played a clean game.
The design had a clean, modern look.
The united team won the championship.
They were united in their decision.
The united effort saved the park.
The United Nations met in New York.
Their united goal was to raise funds.
The kids swam in the pool all day.
The office has a pool of funds for projects.

back_cards.definition_en: A game played on a table
back_cards.example_en: He won a game of pool at the bar.
She was in the pool of job applicants.
A pool of water formed after the rain.
The museum offered an educational tour.
The documentary was highly educational.
They bought educational software for the class.
Reading is an educational activity for kids.
The campaign was educational about recycling.
The bottle was empty after the party.
The streets were empty at midnight.
His promises felt empty to her.
The empty chair was reserved for the guest.
She felt empty after the loss.
The sofa was soft and comfortable.
She felt comfortable in her new home.
The shoes were comfortable for walking.
They lived a comfortable life after retiring.
He was comfortable speaking to strangers.
The police investigated the robbery.
She investigated the history of the castle.
The team investigated the software bug.
Scientists investigated the new species.
He investigated the rumors about the deal.
The guidebook was useful for tourists.
This knife is useful for cutting vegetables.
Her advice was useful during the project.
The app is useful for studying grammar.
The tool was useful for fixing the bike.

back_cards.definition_en: A small bag sewn into clothing
back_cards.example_en: He kept his keys in his pocket.
The trip was paid from her own pocket.
A pocket of fog hid the valley.
She found a pen in the pocket of her bag.
He aimed the ball at the corner pocket.
She bought a digital camera for her trip.
The clock showed the time in digital format.
He works in digital marketing.
The library has a digital collection of books.
The school upgraded to digital whiteboards.
There was plenty of food at the party.
The farm had plenty of fresh vegetables.
We have plenty of time to finish.
The city offers plenty for young professionals.
She brought plenty of snacks for the trip.
The room was entirely dark at night.
The decision was entirely up to her.
The plan was entirely successful.
He was entirely focused on his work.
The house was entirely renovated.
She felt fear walking alone at night.
His fear of heights kept him on the ground.
The news caused fear in the community.
Her fear of spiders was overwhelming.
Fear drove them to lock the doors.
She could afford a new car this year.
The job affords great opportunities.
They couldn’t afford the expensive vacation.
He can’t afford to miss the meeting.
We can’t afford another mistake.

back_cards.definition_en: A sweet substance used in food
back_cards.example_en: She added sugar to her coffee.
The candy was full of sugar.
He called his daughter ‘sugar’.
The recipe called for two cups of sugar.
The juice had natural sugar from apples.
Her teaching inspired many students.
He chose teaching as his career.
The book’s teaching was about kindness.
Her teaching focused on hands-on activities.
His teaching helped me understand math.
He had conservative views on family roles.
She took a conservative approach to investing.
The conservative party won the election.
The town had a conservative attitude.
Her dress was conservative for the event.
The chairman opened the board meeting.
She was elected chairman of the club.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in charge of a committee
back_cards.example_en: The chairman guided the discussion.
He served as chairman of the company.
The chairman announced the new policy.
There was an error in the calculation.
The software crashed due to an error.
His decision was an error in strategy.
The book had a spelling error.
The error cost the team the game.

back_cards.definition_en: A structure over a river or road
back_cards.example_en: The bridge connected the two towns.

back_cards.definition_en: A link between people or ideas
back_cards.example_en: She built a bridge between the teams.
The song’s bridge had a catchy tune.
They played bridge every weekend.
The dentist fitted a bridge for her tooth.
The tall tree shaded the yard.
He was tall for his age.
The city had tall skyscrapers.
That’s a tall tale about catching a huge fish.
She stood tall in her new role.
She asked specifically for green apples.
The tool was designed specifically for this job.
He explained the rules specifically.
The ad was aimed specifically at teens.
The contract was written specifically for her.
She picked a red flower from the garden.
The bride carried a bouquet of flowers.
He gave her flowers for her birthday.
Flowers brightened the park in spring.
The flower bloomed after weeks of care.
She went hiking though it was raining.
He tried hard, though he didn’t win.
The task was simple, though time-consuming.
I’ll help, though I’m busy.
It’s expensive, though worth it.

back_cards.definition_en: All of space and its contents
back_cards.example_en: The universe is vast and mysterious.

back_cards.definition_en: A field of study or interest
back_cards.example_en: She explored the universe of literature.
Scientists study the origins of the universe.
The movie created a new universe for fans.
Her dreams opened a universe of opportunities.
The plants live with enough sunlight.
They live in a small apartment downtown.
She wants to live adventurously.
The band will live stream tonight.
He lives on a tight budget.
He acknowledged his error in the report.
She acknowledged the team’s hard work.
I acknowledged his email yesterday.
He nodded to acknowledge her question.
The author acknowledged her mentor.
The speed limit is 50 mph.
There’s a limit to how much I can spend.

back_cards.definition_en: A point that cannot be exceeded
back_cards.example_en: His patience reached its limit.

back_cards.definition_en: A rule in a game or system
back_cards.example_en: The game has a limit of four players.
The policy sets limits on emissions.
The election got wide media coverage.
Her health plan had good coverage.
The signal coverage was poor in the mountains.
Snow coverage made the roads slippery.
The book provides coverage of history.
The film crew finished shooting the scene.
The crew prepared the plane for takeoff.
The road crew repaired the highway.
She hung out with her crew at the mall.
The concert crew set up the stage.
She located the missing file on her computer.
The store was located in the city center.
He located his lost phone using an app.
They located the leak in the pipe.
The company located its office downtown.
She kept her balance on the tightrope.
The budget needs balance between spending and savings.
The shop used a balance to measure flour.
He found a balance between work and family.
Check the balance before withdrawing money.
They split the cake into equal pieces.
The rules apply equal to everyone.
Her score was equal to his in the game.
She applied gloss to her lip.
The cup had a chipped lip.
The cliff had a narrow lip of rock.

example_en: A smile played on her lips.
The cut on his lip needed stitches.

back_cards.example_en: She leaned against the wall.
He leaned on friends during tough times.
She leans toward a vegetarian diet.

example_en: He leaned over the table to whisper.
The chef leaned the meat for the dish.

back_cards.example_en: Parking is free in this zone.
The city’s industrial zone was busy.
She was in the zone while studying.

example_en: The time zone here is Pacific Standard.
The park has a picnic zone.

back_cards.definition_en: A legal union of two people
back_cards.example_en: Their wedding was a joyful celebration.
The wedding took place in a church.
They invited 100 guests to their wedding.

example_en: The wedding marked the start of their life together.
The wedding followed ancient customs.

back_cards.example_en: She made a copy of the document.
I bought a copy of the magazine.
He wrote the ad copy for the product.

example_en: The painting was a copy of a masterpiece.
Save a copy of your work.

back_cards.example_en: The final score was 3-1.
She got a high score on the exam.
The film’s score was beautiful.

example_en: A score of people gathered outside.
He kept score with scratches on the wall.

back_cards.example_en: He told a joke to make us laugh.
The idea was a joke to her.
The fake spider was a harmless joke.

example_en: The comedian’s joke got big applause.
It was just a joke, don’t be mad.

back_cards.example_en: She bought a used car to save money.

example_en: He was used to waking up early.
The used book had notes in the margins.
The knife was used for cutting rope.
She’s used to the cold winters here.

back_cards.example_en: The instructions were clear and simple.

example_en: The road was clear after the snow melted.
The water in the lake was clear.
Her talent was clear to everyone.
The sky was clear for stargazing.

back_cards.example_en: A bear was spotted near the campsite.
The stock market entered a bear phase.
He’s a bear when he’s hungry.

example_en: The bear of a man lifted the log.
She slept with a teddy bear.

back_cards.example_en: Dinner was a big family meal.
She cooked a healthy meal for lunch.
The holiday meal brought everyone together.

example_en: The meal included soup and bread.
Breakfast is my favorite meal.

back_cards.example_en: The movie got a positive review.
She did a review before the test.
The employee had an annual review.

example_en: His book review was published online.
The team held a project review.

back_cards.definition_en: A smaller group within a larger one
back_cards.example_en: The minority voted against the plan.
The program supports minority students.
Her view was in the minority.

example_en: The minority faced challenges in politics.
A minority of fans left the concert early.

back_cards.example_en: Her sight was perfect without glasses.
The mountain was a beautiful sight.
We caught sight of a rare bird.

example_en: The city’s sights drew many visitors.
He adjusted the rifle’s sight.

back_cards.example_en: She needed more sleep to feel refreshed.
A good night’s sleep helped him focus.
The town was in a deep sleep at midnight.

example_en: Lack of sleep made her irritable.
The baby fell into a quiet sleep.

back_cards.example_en: She studied Russian history in school.
He learned Russian for his trip.
The museum had Russian art on display.

example_en: They served Russian dumplings at the festival.
The Russian team competed in the event.

back_cards.example_en: She wore a red dress to the party.
Her dress was casual for the picnic.
The dress was perfect for the wedding.

example_en: Their dress code was smart dress.

back_cards.example_en: The release of the birds was symbolic.
The phone’s release drew crowds.
The band’s new release topped the charts.

example_en: Exercise was a release for her stress.
The press release explained the policy.

back_cards.example_en: Soviet history was taught in class.
The Soviet system shaped the era.
Soviet films were screened at the festival.
The business made a huge profit.
There’s no profit in arguing.
The shop’s profit was reinvested.

definition_en.example_en: Her hard work was her profit.

back_cards.example_en: Climbing the peak was a real challenge.
He accepted the challenge to a race.
The puzzle was a mental challenge.

example_en: The coach gave the team a challenge.

back_cards.example_en: She was careful when cutting the fabric.

example_en: Be careful crossing the street.

She was careful with the fragile vase.
He was careful with his spending.

back_cards.definition_en: Social roles of male or female
back_cards.example_en: Gender equality is important in the workplace.
French nouns have gender.
They discussed gender in modern society.

example_en: The survey analyzed gender differences.
Gender norms vary across cultures.

back_cards.example_en: She used tape to fix the torn paper.
The old tape held family videos.
He used a tape to measure the room.

example_en: She crossed the finish tape first.
The gift was wrapped with colored tape.

back_cards.example_en: The ocean sparkled under the sun.
An ocean of stars filled the night sky.
The ocean provides fish for the market.

example_en: Scientists study the deep ocean.
They sailed across the ocean.

back_cards.example_en: An unidentified object fell from the sky.

example_en: The caller remained unidentified.
The bag was left unidentified at the station.

The species is still unidentified.

back_cards.example_en: The host welcomed everyone to the party.
The tree was a host to rare insects.

example_en: The city was the host of the games.

back_cards.example_en: She received a grant for her research.
The city issued a grant for the project.
The grant supported the new library.

example_en: The land was a grant from the government.

back_cards.example_en: Due to the circumstance,
She was late for the meeting.

example_en.example_en: It was late in the evening when they arrived.
The late author’s book was published.

back_cards.example_en: The train was late due to rain.

The boss approved the new plan.

example_en: She reported to her boss daily.

He acted like the boss of the group.

back_cards.example_en: The president declared a holiday.

example_en: She declared her support for the cause.
He declared his love for her.

The team declared victory.

back_cards.example_en: She adopted a domestic cat.
Domestic flights were delayed.

example_en: Domestic animals live on farms.

back_cards.definition_en: A hot drink made from leaves
back_cards.example_en: She offered me tea.
They met for tea.
Green tea is healthy.

example_en: Tea was served with scones.
She bought herbal tea.

back_cards.example_en: She organized her closet.

example_en: He organized a charity run.

back_cards.example_en: She’s learning English online.

example_en: English traditions include festivals.

back_cards.example_en: Neither option was good.

example_en: She liked neither candidate.

back_cards.example_en: Either path leads to town.

example_en: You can pick either.

back_cards.example_en: The official report was released.

example_en: She wore an official uniform.

back_cards.example_en: Trees surround the lake.

example_en: Fans surrounded the star.
